description: A vRtrPimIfNeighborLoss notification is generated when the
PIM adjacency with a neighbor is lost.

event.Summary: PIM adjacency with a neighbor is lost

description: The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor
of the local router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfNeighborUpTime

description: A vRtrPimIfNeighborUp notification is generated when the
PIM adjacency with a new neighbor is established.

event.Summary: PIM adjacency with a new neighbor is established

description: The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor
of the local router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfNeighborUpTime

description: A vRtrPimInvalidJoinPrune notification is generated when an invalid
Join Prune message is received. A Join Prune message is deemed
invalid when there is an RP address disagreement between the router
and the PIM Join Prune message.

event.Summary: Invalid join prune message is received

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimInvalidJoinPrune TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfRxInvalidJoinPrunes c 9999 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifySourceIp a 192.0.2.1 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr a 192.0.2.1 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyRPAddr a 192.0.2.1 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyWrongRPAddr a 192.0.2.1

description: The value of vRtrPimIfRxInvalidJoinPrunes indicates the number of
invalid PIM Join Prune messages received on this interface.
A Join Prune message is invalid when the RP address in the message
is not the RP for the group specified in the message.
If such a message arrives, a vRtrPimInvalidJoinPrune
notification is sent.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfRxInvalidJoinPrunes

description: vRtrPimNotifySourceIp indicates the address from which the PIM message
originated.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifySourceIp

description: vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr indicates the group address in the PIM message.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr

description: vRtrPimNotifyRPAddr indicates the RP address on the router
corresponding to the group address in the PIM message.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyRPAddr

description: vRtrPimNotifyWrongRPAddr indicates the RP address in the PIM message
corresponding to the group address in the message. Whenever there
is an disagreement between the RP address on the router and the RP
address in the PIM message, this object is used by the notifications
to send the RP address in the PIM message.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyWrongRPAddr

description: A vRtrPimInvalidRegister notification is generated when an invalid
PIM Register message is received. A Register message is deemed
invalid when there is an RP address disagreement between the router
and the PIM Register message.

event.Summary: Invalid PIM ($v1) register message is received

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimInvalidRegister TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfRxInvalidRegisters c 9999 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifySourceIp a 192.0.2.1 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr a 192.0.2.1 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyRPAddr a 192.0.2.1 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyWrongRPAddr a 192.0.2.1

description: The value of vRtrPimIfRxInvalidRegisters indicates the number of
invalid PIM Register messages received on this interface.
A Register message is invalid when the RP address in the message
is not the RP for the group specified in the message. If such a
message arrives, a vRtrPimInvalidRegister notification is sent.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfRxInvalidRegisters

description: vRtrPimNotifySourceIp indicates the address from which the PIM message
originated.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifySourceIp

description: vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr indicates the group address in the PIM message.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr

description: vRtrPimNotifyRPAddr indicates the RP address on the router
corresponding to the group address in the PIM message.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyRPAddr

description: vRtrPimNotifyWrongRPAddr indicates the RP address in the PIM message
corresponding to the group address in the message. Whenever there
is an disagreement between the RP address on the router and the RP
address in the PIM message, this object is used by the notifications
to send the RP address in the PIM message.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyWrongRPAddr

description: A vRtrPimGrpInSSMRange notification is generated
when the router receives a register message, a (*,G) assert message
a (*,G) Join Prune message or a IGMP local membership message for the
group defined in the SSM address range.
The SSM standard designates group IP addresses in the
232/8 (232.0.0.0 to 232.255.255.255) range for SSM destination
addresses. Additional SSM ranges can be configured using the
vRtrPimSSMGroupTable.

event.Summary: Router received $v4 message for the group defined in the SSM address range

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimGrpInSSMRange TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfRxPkts c 9999 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifySourceIp a 192.0.2.1 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr a 192.0.2.1 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyMesgType i 0

description: The value of vRtrPimIfRxPkts indicates the number of multicast data
packets received on this interface.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfRxPkts

description: vRtrPimNotifySourceIp indicates the address from which the PIM message
originated.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifySourceIp

description: vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr indicates the group address in the PIM message.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr

description: vRtrPimNotifyMesgType indicates the types of PIM message.
This object is used by vRtrPimGrpInSSMRange notification to identify
the type of PIM message.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyMesgType

description: A vRtrPimBSRStateChange notification is generated whenever there is
a change in the BSR state on the router. vRtrPimGenBSRState will
indicate the current BSR state.

event.Summary: BSR state on the router changed to $v1

description: vRtrPimGenBSRState indicates the state of the router with respect to
the bootstrap mechanism.
'candidateBSR', 'pendingBSR' and 'electedBSR' are the states of the
router participating in the Bootstrap election.
'acceptAny' and 'acceptPreferred' are the states of the router
not participating in the Bootstrap election.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimGenBSRState

description: A vRtrPimHelloDropped notification is generated whenever a hello
is dropped because the vRtrPimIfMulticastSenders flag is set to
'always'.
The time since this PIM neighbor (last) became a neighbor
of the local router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfNeighborUpTime

description: A vRtrPimSGLimitExceeded notification is generated when
a (S,G) record is failed to be programmed to an IOM because the
supported (S,G) limit is exceeded. This limit is currently at
16000 (S,G) entries.
The value of tmnxCardHwIndex is the index into the tmnxHwTable for the
row entry that represents the hardware component information for this
IOM card.
variables.name: TIMETRA-CHASSIS-MIB::tmnxCardHwIndex

description: A vRtrPimReplicationLimitExceeded notification is generated
when an IOM fails to program an OIF for an (S,G) record because
the replication limit for that (S,G) on that IOM has been reached.
The replication limit per (S,G) entry on an IOM is currently 127.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimReplicationLimitExceeded TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifySourceIp a 192.0.2.1 TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr a 192.0.2.1 TIMETRA-CHASSIS-MIB::tmnxCardHwIndex i 9999

description: vRtrPimNotifySourceIp indicates the address from which the PIM message
originated.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifySourceIp

description: vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr indicates the group address in the PIM message.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr

description: The value of tmnxCardHwIndex is the index into the tmnxHwTable for the
row entry that represents the hardware component information for this
IOM card.
variables.name: TIMETRA-CHASSIS-MIB::tmnxCardHwIndex

description: A vRtrPimMDTLimitExceeded notification is generated when the
configuration exceeds the maximum number of Multicast
Distribution Trees (MDTs) supported on the system.

event.Summary: Configuration exceeded the maximum number of MDTs ($v2) supported on the system

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: vRtrPimGenMaxMdts indicates the maximum number of Multicast
Distribution Trees (MDTs) that can be configured on the system.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimGenMaxMdts

description: The vRtrPimMaxGrpsLimitExceeded event is generated when an attempt is
made to configure a group when vRtrPimIfCurrentGroups, the number of
groups configured on the PIM interface, is equal to vRtrPimIfMaxGroups,
the maximum number of groups supported on the system.
The value of vRtrPimIfMaxGroups specifies the maximum number of groups
for which PIM can have downstream state based on received PIM Joins on
this interface. This does not include IGMP local receivers on the
interface. When this configuration is changed dynamically to a value
lower than the currently accepted number of groups, the groups that
are already accepted are not deleted. Only new groups will not be
allowed. When this object has a value of 0, there is no limit to the
number of groups.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfMaxGroups

description: The vRtrPimDataMtReused event is generated when a data MDT is reused,
i.e. a C (S,G) is mapped to a data MDT that is already in use by
another C (S,G).
The value of vRtrPimDataMtIfIndex indicates the interface index
of the Multicast Data Tunnel(Data MT) interface. This value will be
non-zero integer value specific to the router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimDataMtIfIndex

description: The value of vRtrPimDataMtNumVpnSGs indicates the number of C-(S,G)'s
mapped to this Multicast Tunnel(MT) interface.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimDataMtNumVpnSGs

description: The vRtrPimMcacPlcyDropped event is generated when a
PIM group is dropped on a given interface because of
applying a multicast CAC policy given by vRtrPimIfMcacPolicyName.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimMcacPlcyDropped TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfMcacPolicyName s EXAMPLE TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr a 192.0.2.1

description: The value of vRtrPimIfMcacPolicyName specifies the name
of the multicast CAC policy.
The multicast cac policy applies the interface cac algorithm if
the channel(group) on this interface is part of the policy as specified
in vRtrPimIfMcacPolicyName.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimIfMcacPolicyName

description: vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr indicates the group address in the PIM message.
variables.name: TIMETRA-PIM-MIB::vRtrPimNotifyGroupAddr
